Begin Week 1!





## Load dataset


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```


## Comparing R graphics with ggplot2

::: panel-tabset
#### R graphics


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(exam_data$MATHS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### ggplot2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="black", 
                 fill="grey") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

:::

::: callout-note
## So ggplot2 is better!
:::

## Exploring ggplot2

::: panel-tabset
#### Bar chart


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Dot plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize = 0.5,
               binwidth = 2.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,
                     breaks = NULL)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "grey20") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("pink", "steelblue"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Kernel density


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           color = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Box plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("pink", "steelblue"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Violin plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Scatterplot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100),
                  ylim = c(0, 100))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

:::

## Some other elements...

#### Combining geom objects + stat


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE) +
  geom_point(position = "jitter",
             size = 0.5) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("pink", "steelblue")) +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun = "mean",
               colour = "red",
               size = 4) +
  theme_classic()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


::: callout-note
## Theme used: Classic
:::

#### Scatterplot with best fit line!


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm,
              linewidth = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Working with facets


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
  facet_wrap(~ CLASS) +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


::: callout-caution
## Theme used: Minimal
:::

And that's it for Week 1!
